revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Magnadyne |model=MV2458 |fcc_date=09/13/2017 |is_manuf=No |type=wireless router, repeater |fcc_id=ZGM-MV2458 |ic_id=23051-MV2458 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8881A |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9751G6KB-25 |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8881 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi2_chip1_model=RTL8192ER |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=MV2458-2.4G, MV2458-5.4G |default_ip=192.168.10.1 |default_pass=admin }}
May be associated with brand names including MOBILEVISION, RV-LINK, and TRUCK-LINK
"04G0012202A0 R142A_VER1.1" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Brand website: www.magnadyne.com
As with the [[Magnadyne MV2400]] the final image in the FCC internal photos document appears to show a different product with "R122QH_VER1.1" silkscreened on its board.
According to the [https://fccid.io/ZGM-MV2458/RF-Exposure-Info/MPE-3559350 RF Exposure Info] document submitted to the FCC, "the 2.4G & 5G can't work [at the] same time" so this may be a selectable dual-band device despite having two radios.
FCC docs claim up to 433Mbps 802.11n speeds at 5GHz but this is assumed to be a single stream 802.11ac radio like the RTL8881A although the heatsink is not removed from the CPU in pictures.
{{See also|Magnadyne MV2400}}
